summary: This document contains two affidavits signed by Ghislaine Maxwell in December 2020, waiving her rights to contest extradition from the United Kingdom and France to the United States. The affidavits are part of her bail conditions in her criminal case and are intended to be used if she violates bail and flees to those countries.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case who is signing affidavits waiving extradition rights from the UK and France as part of her bail conditions. She is incarcerated at the Metropolitan Detention Center.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: One of Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys with whom she reviewed the charges in the superseding indictment.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: One of Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys with whom she reviewed the charges in the superseding indictment.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge who certified that Ghislaine Maxwell personally appeared and swore to the truth of the statements in the affidavits.

connections.description: Mark S. Cohen is listed as counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell, with whom she reviewed the charges in the indictment.
Christian R. Everdell is listed as counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell, with whom she reviewed the charges in the indictment.
Both are attorneys from the same firm (Cohen & Gresser, LLP) representing Ghislaine Maxwell.
Judge Alison J. Nathan certified Ghislaine Maxwell's appearance and oath for the affidavits.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell signs extradition waivers
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell signs affidavits waiving her rights to contest extradition from the United Kingdom and France to the United States as part of her bail conditions.

events.title: Maxwell moves to the United States
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell states she has resided in the United States since approximately 1991.

locations: Metropolitan Detention Center, Brooklyn, New York
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell holds citizenship in three countries: the United States, the United Kingdom, and France.
The affidavits are conditional waivers; they only take effect if Maxwell is released on bail and then violates her bail conditions, triggering an extradition request.
The documents reveal Maxwell's legal strategy to facilitate potential extradition from the UK and France to avoid lengthy legal battles if she flees.
Maxwell was incarcerated at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, New York, as of December 2020.
The waivers reference a superseding indictment in case number 20-CR-330, indicating ongoing federal criminal proceedings against her.
